Matchers.description:
Matchers is a slice of Matchers that is sortable, implements Stringer, and
provides a Matches method to match a LabelSet against all Matchers in the
slice. Note that some users of Matchers might require it to be sorted.

ObjectMatchers.description:
Matchers is a slice of Matchers that is sortable, implements Stringer, and
provides a Matches method to match a LabelSet against all Matchers in the
slice. Note that some users of Matchers might require it to be sorted.

Regexp.description:
A Regexp is safe for concurrent use by multiple goroutines,
except for configuration methods, such as Longest.

from.description:
RelativeTimeRange is the per query start and end time
for requests.

to.description:
RelativeTimeRange is the per query start and end time
for requests.

RelativeTimeRange.description:
RelativeTimeRange is the per query start and end time

days_of_month.description:
TimeInterval describes intervals of time. ContainsTime will tell you if a golang time is contained
within the interval.

from.description: Redefining this to avoid an import cycle

to.description: Redefining this to avoid an import cycle

TimeRange.description: Redefining this to avoid an import cycle

interval.description:
The interval, in seconds, at which all rules in the group are evaluated.
If a group contains many rules, the rules are evaluated sequentially.

for.description:
The amount of time, in seconds, for which the rule must be breached for the rule to be considered to be Firing.
Before this time has elapsed, the rule is only considered to be Pending.

continue.description:
A Route is a node that contains definitions of how to handle alerts. This is modified
from the upstream alertmanager in that it adds the ObjectMatchers property.
